member.name: D3D12_DRIVER_MATCHING_IDENTIFIER_STATUS
member.summary: Specifies the result of a call to which queries whether serialized data is compatible with the current device and driver version.

member.name: D3D12_DRIVER_MATCHING_IDENTIFIER_STATUS.D3D12_DRIVER_MATCHING_IDENTIFIER_COMPATIBLE_WITH_DEVICE
member.summary: Serialized data is compatible with the current device/driver.

member.name: D3D12_DRIVER_MATCHING_IDENTIFIER_STATUS.D3D12_DRIVER_MATCHING_IDENTIFIER_UNSUPPORTED_TYPE
member.summary: The specified specified is unknown or unsupported.

member.name: D3D12_DRIVER_MATCHING_IDENTIFIER_STATUS.D3D12_DRIVER_MATCHING_IDENTIFIER_UNRECOGNIZED
member.summary: Format of the data in is unrecognized. This could indicate either corrupt data or the identifier was produced by a different hardware vendor.

member.name: D3D12_DRIVER_MATCHING_IDENTIFIER_STATUS.D3D12_DRIVER_MATCHING_IDENTIFIER_INCOMPATIBLE_VERSION
member.summary: Serialized data is recognized, but its version is not compatible with the current driver. This result may indicate that the device is from the same hardware vendor but is an incompatible version.

member.name: D3D12_DRIVER_MATCHING_IDENTIFIER_STATUS.D3D12_DRIVER_MATCHING_IDENTIFIER_INCOMPATIBLE_TYPE
member.summary: specifies a data type that is not compatible with the type of serialized data. As long as there is only a single defined serialized data type this error cannot not be produced.
